name: lopsidedness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of having one side bigger, higher, etc. than the other: The doctor decided to operate again to try to correct the lopsidedness of his face. I am curious to see if the tree can cure its own lopsidedness. Related word
lopsided
the fact of not being equally balanced in amount, importance, etc.: Despite the lopsidedness of the defeat, he said he doesn't feel too bad. The lopsidedness is further reinforced by the huge weight of one company, which accounts for almost half the total market. Related word
lopsided
More examplesFewer examplesHis lopsidedness (he has one leg shorter than the other) was discovered during a routine medical.One unfortunate side-effect of intensive breeding of fish is lopsidedness.The stark scope of the challenge was made clear in the lopsidedness of the delegates' vote: 2,329 for and 505 against.It's hard to overstate the political lopsidedness of American college faculties these days.
